intro: Pluchea grevei var. grevei, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical characteristics make it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
